image.altText: bogged ute in flood waters

props.synopsis: The trough in the Gulf of Carpentaria is expected to turn into a tropical low next week, increasing the risk of a cyclone in a region still recovering after Jasper.

title.children: Tropical low expected in Far North Queensland next week, increasing cyclone risk in region still recovering after Jasper

image.altText: A close up of a cacti dotting a desert underneath a blazing sun.

props.synopsis: While it's already been called the world's hottest year, the full set of climate data up to December 31 shows global temperatures reached "exceptionally" high levels in 2023.

title.children: 2023 saw climate records 'tumbling like dominoes'

image.altText: A man standing in front of a flooded river

props.synopsis: Flood levels are receding in parts of the state, but as some communities return home, others are preparing for flooding that could still inundate their properties.

title.children: Downstream residents still bracing for flood peak as others begin clean-up in regional Victoria

image.altText: A robot scans a patient's heard

props.synopsis: In a world-first, sonographers can now assess the health of patients thousands of kilometres away. The technology has saved almost a dozen full trips around the world in distance travelled.

title.children: This remote-controlled robot is performing lifesaving heart scans

image.altText: Australian tennis player Arina Rodionova shrugs while holding a tennis racquet.

props.synopsis: Arina Rodionova says Tennis Australia will be "celebrating" because she will not play the Australian Open after missing out on a wildcard and losing in qualifying.

title.children: 'I am not liked': Top-ranked Aussie woman says decision not to give her an AO wildcard feels personal

image.altText: A woman's silhouette in a doorframe.

props.synopsis: Evie was 12 when she went into the care of the Department of Child Safety under the promise of better mental health care in regional Queensland. Now, her family is fighting to bring her home.

title.children: Mum's desperate fight for daughter's release three years after 'temporary' care placement

image.altText: A man and woman stand next to a plane's door which is on the groiund.

props.synopsis: Bob Sauer, a science teacher in Portland, Oregon, discovered the Alaska Airlines door plug sitting among the trees in his backyard.

title.children: Teacher becomes overnight celebrity after discovering Boeing door plug in backyard

image.altText: Image of a house that has collapsed after the earthquake.

props.synopsis: An enormous earthquake hit Japan on New Year's Day, initially prompting fears of a deadly tsunami on the country's west coast. Wajima is one of the worst hit cities on the remote Noto Peninsula.

title.children: Near the epicentre of Japan's New Year's Day earthquake, locals are still looking for loved ones under the rubble

image.altText: a plastic bag with the words 'the iconic' on it

props.synopsis: Online retailer The Iconic has vowed to refund customers who have been left out of pocket by thousands of dollars after their accounts were compromised and fraudulent orders were made without their permission.

title.children: The Iconic online retailer faces customer fury over fraudulent transactions

image.altText: Footage shows a shark pithing

props.synopsis: Sandy golden beaches are a tourism jackpot for the Sunshine State, and the Queensland government literally kills to keep it that way.

title.children: Tiger shark stabbed in the head, heart removed to keep swimmers safe at Queensland beaches

image.altText: Woman walks past Sydney Harbour Bridge wearing a mask

props.synopsis: NSW has seen the highest level of COVID in a year with two variants being behind the bulk of cases, as the health department urges those infected with the virus to stay home.

title.children: New variants drive NSW to 'highest level of COVID in a year'

image.altText: An ocean-going turtle swims towards the camera with a plastic bag hanging from its mouth

props.synopsis: You might have caught the latest Attenborough documentary in your holiday downtime. And while awe-inspiring and confronting wildlife footage can raise awareness of environmental issues, whether it compels lasting behavioural change is a different story.

title.children: Nature documentaries wow us, but do they inspire us to save the planet?

image.altText: A man with fair hair, wearing black jacket and light shirt, smiles with mouth closed. He's surrounded by bushes.

props.synopsis: As John Gilius's partner came closer to dying from terminal cancer, the couple decided to mark the event in a very special, and very joyous, way.

title.children: Why a 'living funeral' was the right decision for John and his partner in the face of death

image.altText: Flooding around Robelle Domain at Springfield Lakes.

props.synopsis: Severe thunderstorms cause flash flooding at Springfield Lakes as the Bureau of Meteorology warns much of the state faced unsettled weather.

title.children: Over 130mm of rain recorded in three hours south-west of Brisbane, bringing worst flash flooding some locals have seen

image.altText: Renee Oakley squats down between two very happy Golden Retrievers

props.synopsis: While most take time off over summer to holiday and enjoy life, many Australians work through the traditional break, sacrificing their family time to keep businesses and emergency services running.

title.children: Meet some Australians working through summer so the rest of us can holiday

image.altText: Bite marks and dents on the underside of a white surfboard

props.synopsis: The attack off South Australia's Eyre Peninsula happened about 200 metres from the beach, with the man able to make his own way back to shore.

title.children: Surfer takes himself to hospital after shark bites his leg

image.altText: A middle-aged Taiwanese man in a suit looks at his phone while standing behind a podium.

props.synopsis: The Taiwanese defence ministry mistranslated an alert into English, saying China had launched a missile instead of a satellite and urging caution days before the island’s elections.

title.children: Taiwan's defence ministry mistranslates alert, falsely says China launched missile

image.altText: A man in a dark suit speaks at a podium

props.synopsis: French media is reporting he will replace Elisabeth Borne, who resigned earlier this week.

title.children: Macron appoints youngest and first openly gay French prime minister

image.altText: Man in blazer holding up microphone and singing at a concert

props.synopsis: The sign was unveiled on what would have been the musician's 77th birthday.

title.children: David Bowie celebrated in Paris with street honouring his legacy

image.altText: The outside of Carnarvon Court House.

props.synopsis: A 28-year-old woman faces court after allegedly attempting to detain two children, aged two and six, while walking her dog in Exmouth.

title.children: Childcare worker refused bail after allegedly detaining two children in WA

image.altText: A fat, black crocodile climbs onto a slightly raised concrete wall between two pools of water.

props.synopsis: Spouting water, hissing and blowing bubbles might not work for humans on the dating scene, but according to Sunshine Coast researchers, for saltwater crocodiles it's a different story.

title.children: Scientists creating dictionary of saltwater croc sounds capture reptilian 'love song' on tape

image.altText: a dog sits in a rusted cage in the back of a pickup truck

props.synopsis: The landmark bill will make the slaughtering, breeding, trade and sale of dog meat for human consumption illegal from 2027, ending the controversial centuries-old practice.

title.children: South Korea passes bill to outlaw dog meat industry

image.altText: A headshot of Dmitry Rybolovelev wearing glasses and a navy suit jacket.

props.synopsis: Sotheby's has defended itself, saying it knew nothing of wrongdoing by an art buyer who advised the billionaire on buying works that he was paying secret mark-ups on.

title.children: Russian billionaire blames Sotheby's for losing millions paying mark-ups for Picasso, da Vinci artworks

image.altText: A close up of the damaged surface of a spacecraft as it floats through space.

props.synopsis: A private company's Peregrine lander appears unlikely to complete its original mission after running into issues on its way to the Moon.

title.children: The first US Moon landing in more than 50 years has hit a major hurdle after a 'critical' fuel leak

image.altText: A security guard misting a music festival crowd with water from a hose

props.synopsis: Festival goers say they were crammed into a carpark with 1,000 others without water or ventilation as they waited to be let into a New Year's Eve event in Brisbane.

title.children: Event organisers told to prepare for extreme weather after thousands swelter in festival carpark

props.synopsis: Home to almost all the world's marine turtle species, Queensland researchers say there's real concern for the survival of these ancient species.

title.children: They've survived for 120 million years, but scientists aren't sure Queensland's sea turtles will see the next millennia

image.altText: Shirtless man with hands on hand

props.synopsis: The notorious Los Choneros gangster Jose Adolfo Macias escaped on Sunday, marking his second prison break in 10 years.

title.children: Ecuador under state of emergency after powerful drug lord 'Fito' escapes maximum security jail

image.altText: A film still of Jamael Westman, Himesh Patel, Ruth Negga and Daniel Levy, sitting close together on a couch, smiling.

props.synopsis: The directorial debut of Schitt's Creek creator and star Dan Levy sees the actor's character Marc navigating the stormy waters of grief, with help from his friends.

title.children: Dan Levy's movie debut uncovers the lies we tell each other and ourselves to move forward

image.altText: Hundreds of thousands of people crowd the streets with people trying to climb a glass-covered carriage.

props.synopsis: Authorities estimate 2 million devotees will join the Black Nazarene procession for the centuries-old tradition.

title.children: Massive crowds of Phillippine Catholics swarm statue of Jesus Christ believed to have healing powers
